description: Use to create a code review with a CodeReviewType of RepositoryAnalysis. This type of code review analyzes all code under a specified branch in an associated repository. PullRequest code reviews are automatically triggered by a pull request.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the code review. The name of each code review in your Amazon Web Services account must be unique.

parameters.name: RepositoryAssociationArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the RepositoryAssociation object. You can retrieve this ARN by calling ListRepositoryAssociations. A code review can only be created on an associated repository. This is the ARN of the associated repository.

parameters.name: Type
parameters.description: The type of code review to create. This is specified using a CodeReviewType object. You can create a code review only of type RepositoryAnalysis. A code review that analyzes all code under a specified branch in an associated repository. The associated repository is specified using its ARN in CreateCodeReview. RepositoryHead (dict) --- A SourceCodeType that specifies the tip of a branch in an associated repository. The name of the branch in an associated repository. The RepositoryHeadSourceCodeType specifies the tip of this branch. SourceCodeType (dict) --- Specifies the source code that is analyzed in a code review. CommitDiff (dict) --- A SourceCodeType that specifies a commit diff created by a pull request on an associated repository. SourceCommit (string) --- The SHA of the source commit used to generate a commit diff. This field is required for a pull request code review. DestinationCommit (string) --- The SHA of the destination commit used to generate a commit diff. MergeBaseCommit (string) --- The SHA of the merge base of a commit. BranchDiff (dict) --- A type of SourceCodeType that specifies a source branch name and a destination branch name in an associated repository. The source branch for a diff in an associated repository. The destination branch for a diff in an associated repository. S3BucketRepository (dict) --- Information about an associated repository in an S3 bucket that includes its name and an S3RepositoryDetails object. The S3RepositoryDetails object includes the name of an S3 bucket, an S3 key for a source code .zip file, and an S3 key for a build artifacts .zip file. S3BucketRepository is required in SourceCodeType for S3BucketRepository based code reviews. The name of the repository when the ProviderType is S3Bucket. Details (dict) --- An S3RepositoryDetails object that specifies the name of an S3 bucket and a CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object keys for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file. BucketName (string) --- The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-. CodeArtifacts (dict) --- A CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object key for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files. The S3 object key for a source code .zip file. This is required for all code reviews. BuildArtifactsObjectKey (string) --- The S3 object key for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files. This is required for a code review with security analysis. For more information, see Create code reviews with GitHub Actions in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide. RequestMetadata (dict) --- Metadata that is associated with a code review. This applies to any type of code review supported by CodeGuru Reviewer. The RequestMetadaa field captures any event metadata. For example, it might capture metadata associated with an event trigger, such as a push or a pull request. RequestId (string) --- The ID of the request. This is required for a pull request code review. Requester (string) --- An identifier, such as a name or account ID, that is associated with the requester. The Requester is used to capture the author/actor name of the event request. EventInfo (dict) --- Information about the event associated with a code review. Name (string) --- The name of the event. The possible names are pull_request, workflow_dispatch, schedule, and push State (string) --- The state of an event. The state might be open, closed, or another state. VendorName (string) --- The name of the repository vendor used to upload code to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review. For example, if code and artifacts are uploaded to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review by GitHub scripts from a GitHub repository, then the repository association's ProviderType is S3Bucket and the CI/CD repository vendor name is GitHub. For more information, see the definition for ProviderType in RepositoryAssociation. AnalysisTypes (list) --- They types of analysis performed during a repository analysis or a pull request review. You can specify either Security, CodeQuality, or both. (string) ---

nested_params.name: RepositoryAnalysis
nested_params.description: A code review that analyzes all code under a specified branch in an associated repository. The associated repository is specified using its ARN in CreateCodeReview.

nested_params.name: RepositoryHead
nested_params.description: A SourceCodeType that specifies the tip of a branch in an associated repository.

nested_params.name: BranchName
nested_params.description: The name of the branch in an associated repository. The RepositoryHeadSourceCodeType specifies the tip of this branch.

nested_params.name: SourceCodeType
nested_params.description: Specifies the source code that is analyzed in a code review.

nested_params.name: CommitDiff
nested_params.description: A SourceCodeType that specifies a commit diff created by a pull request on an associated repository.

nested_params.name: SourceCommit
nested_params.description: The SHA of the source commit used to generate a commit diff. This field is required for a pull request code review.

nested_params.name: DestinationCommit
nested_params.description: The SHA of the destination commit used to generate a commit diff. This field is required for a pull request code review.

nested_params.name: MergeBaseCommit
nested_params.description: The SHA of the merge base of a commit.

nested_params.name: RepositoryHead
nested_params.description: A SourceCodeType that specifies the tip of a branch in an associated repository.

nested_params.name: BranchName
nested_params.description: The name of the branch in an associated repository. The RepositoryHeadSourceCodeType specifies the tip of this branch.

nested_params.name: BranchDiff
nested_params.description: A type of SourceCodeType that specifies a source branch name and a destination branch name in an associated repository.

nested_params.name: SourceBranchName
nested_params.description: The source branch for a diff in an associated repository.

nested_params.name: DestinationBranchName
nested_params.description: The destination branch for a diff in an associated repository.

nested_params.name: S3BucketRepository
nested_params.description: Information about an associated repository in an S3 bucket that includes its name and an S3RepositoryDetails object. The S3RepositoryDetails object includes the name of an S3 bucket, an S3 key for a source code .zip file, and an S3 key for a build artifacts .zip file. S3BucketRepository is required in SourceCodeType for S3BucketRepository based code reviews.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the repository when the ProviderType is S3Bucket.

nested_params.name: Details
nested_params.description: An S3RepositoryDetails object that specifies the name of an S3 bucket and a CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object keys for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file.

nested_params.name: BucketName
nested_params.description: The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-.

nested_params.name: CodeArtifacts
nested_params.description: A CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object key for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files.

nested_params.name: SourceCodeArtifactsObjectKey
nested_params.description: The S3 object key for a source code .zip file. This is required for all code reviews.

nested_params.name: BuildArtifactsObjectKey
nested_params.description: The S3 object key for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files. This is required for a code review with security analysis. For more information, see Create code reviews with GitHub Actions in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide.

nested_params.name: RequestMetadata
nested_params.description: Metadata that is associated with a code review. This applies to any type of code review supported by CodeGuru Reviewer. The RequestMetadaa field captures any event metadata. For example, it might capture metadata associated with an event trigger, such as a push or a pull request.

nested_params.name: RequestId
nested_params.description: The ID of the request. This is required for a pull request code review.

nested_params.name: Requester
nested_params.description: An identifier, such as a name or account ID, that is associated with the requester. The Requester is used to capture the author/actor name of the event request.

nested_params.name: EventInfo
nested_params.description: Information about the event associated with a code review.

nested_params.name: Name
nested_params.description: The name of the event. The possible names are pull_request, workflow_dispatch, schedule, and push.

nested_params.name: State
nested_params.description: The state of an event. The state might be open, closed, or another state.

nested_params.name: VendorName
nested_params.description: The name of the repository vendor used to upload code to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review. For example, if code and artifacts are uploaded to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review by GitHub scripts from a GitHub repository, then the repository association's ProviderType is S3Bucket and the CI/CD repository vendor name is GitHub. For more information, see the definition for ProviderType in RepositoryAssociation.

nested_params.name: AnalysisTypes
nested_params.description: They types of analysis performed during a repository analysis or a pull request review. You can specify either Security, CodeQuality, or both.

parameters.name: ClientRequestToken
parameters.description: Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer uses this value to prevent the accidental creation of duplicate code reviews if there are failures and retries. This field is autopopulated if not provided.

nested_items.name: CodeReview
nested_items.description: Information about a code review. A code review belongs to the associated repository that contains the reviewed code.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the code review.

nested_items.name: CodeReviewArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the CodeReview object.

nested_items.name: RepositoryName
nested_items.description: The name of the repository.

nested_items.name: Owner
nested_items.description: The owner of the repository. For an Amazon Web Services CodeCommit repository, this is the Amazon Web Services account ID of the account that owns the repository. For a GitHub, GitHub Enterprise Server, or Bitbucket repository, this is the username for the account that owns the repository. For an S3 repository, it can be the username or Amazon Web Services account ID.

nested_items.name: ProviderType
nested_items.description: The type of repository that contains the reviewed code (for example, GitHub or Bitbucket).

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The valid code review states are:
Completed: The code review is complete.
Pending: The code review started and has not completed or failed.
Failed: The code review failed.
Deleting: The code review is being deleted.

nested_items.name: StateReason
nested_items.description: The reason for the state of the code review.

nested_items.name: CreatedTimeStamp
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the code review was created.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedTimeStamp
nested_items.description: The time, in milliseconds since the epoch, when the code review was last updated.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of code review.

nested_items.name: PullRequestId
nested_items.description: The pull request ID for the code review.

nested_items.name: SourceCodeType
nested_items.description: The type of the source code for the code review.

nested_items.name: CommitDiff
nested_items.description: A SourceCodeType that specifies a commit diff created by a pull request on an associated repository.

nested_items.name: SourceCommit
nested_items.description: The SHA of the source commit used to generate a commit diff. This field is required for a pull request code review.

nested_items.name: DestinationCommit
nested_items.description: The SHA of the destination commit used to generate a commit diff. This field is required for a pull request code review.

nested_items.name: MergeBaseCommit
nested_items.description: The SHA of the merge base of a commit.

nested_items.name: RepositoryHead
nested_items.description: A SourceCodeType that specifies the tip of a branch in an associated repository.

nested_items.name: BranchName
nested_items.description: The name of the branch in an associated repository. The RepositoryHeadSourceCodeType specifies the tip of this branch.

nested_items.name: BranchDiff
nested_items.description: A type of SourceCodeType that specifies a source branch name and a destination branch name in an associated repository.

nested_items.name: SourceBranchName
nested_items.description: The source branch for a diff in an associated repository.

nested_items.name: DestinationBranchName
nested_items.description: The destination branch for a diff in an associated repository.

nested_items.name: S3BucketRepository
nested_items.description: Information about an associated repository in an S3 bucket that includes its name and an S3RepositoryDetails object. The S3RepositoryDetails object includes the name of an S3 bucket, an S3 key for a source code .zip file, and an S3 key for a build artifacts .zip file. S3BucketRepository is required in SourceCodeType for S3BucketRepository based code reviews.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the repository when the ProviderType is S3Bucket.

nested_items.name: BucketName
nested_items.description: The name of the S3 bucket used for associating a new S3 repository. It must begin with codeguru-reviewer-.

nested_items.name: CodeArtifacts
nested_items.description: A CodeArtifacts object. The CodeArtifacts object includes the S3 object key for a source code .zip file and for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files.

nested_items.name: SourceCodeArtifactsObjectKey
nested_items.description: The S3 object key for a source code .zip file. This is required for all code reviews.

nested_items.name: BuildArtifactsObjectKey
nested_items.description: The S3 object key for a build artifacts .zip file that contains .jar or .class files. This is required for a code review with security analysis. For more information, see Create code reviews with GitHub Actions in the Amazon CodeGuru Reviewer User Guide.

nested_items.name: RequestMetadata
nested_items.description: Metadata that is associated with a code review. This applies to any type of code review supported by CodeGuru Reviewer. The RequestMetadaa field captures any event metadata. For example, it might capture metadata associated with an event trigger, such as a push or a pull request.

nested_items.name: RequestId
nested_items.description: The ID of the request. This is required for a pull request code review.

nested_items.name: Requester
nested_items.description: An identifier, such as a name or account ID, that is associated with the requester. The Requester is used to capture the author/actor name of the event request.

nested_items.name: EventInfo
nested_items.description: Information about the event associated with a code review.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the event. The possible names are pull_request, workflow_dispatch, schedule, and push.

nested_items.name: State
nested_items.description: The state of an event. The state might be open, closed, or another state.

nested_items.name: VendorName
nested_items.description: The name of the repository vendor used to upload code to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review. For example, if code and artifacts are uploaded to an S3 bucket for a CI/CD code review by GitHub scripts from a GitHub repository, then the repository association's ProviderType is S3Bucket and the CI/CD repository vendor name is GitHub. For more information, see the definition for ProviderType in RepositoryAssociation.

nested_items.name: AssociationArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the RepositoryAssociation that contains the reviewed source code. You can retrieve associated repository ARNs by calling ListRepositoryAssociations.

nested_items.name: MeteredLinesOfCodeCount
nested_items.description: MeteredLinesOfCodeCount is the number of lines of code in the repository where the code review happened. This does not include non-code lines such as comments and blank lines.

nested_items.name: SuppressedLinesOfCodeCount
nested_items.description: SuppressedLinesOfCodeCount is the number of lines of code in the repository where the code review happened that CodeGuru Reviewer did not analyze. The lines suppressed in the analysis is based on the excludeFiles variable in the aws-codeguru-reviewer.yml file. This number does not include non-code lines such as comments and blank lines.

nested_items.name: FindingsCount
nested_items.description: Total number of recommendations found in the code review.

nested_items.name: AnalysisTypes
nested_items.description: The types of analysis performed during a repository analysis or a pull request review. You can specify either Security, CodeQuality, or both.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ConfigFileState
nested_items.description: The state of the aws-codeguru-reviewer.yml configuration file that allows the configuration of the CodeGuru Reviewer analysis. The file either exists, doesn't exist, or exists with errors at the root directory of your repository.
